channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: House Republicans hope Trump can tamp down rebellion around their signature bill
item.description: President Trump is expected to travel to Capitol Hill on Tuesday to persuade holdouts in his party to back a massive tax bill that includes cuts to Medicaid.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump is expected to travel to Capitol Hill on Tuesday to persuade holdouts in his party to back a massive tax bill that includes cuts to Medicaid.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Tornado outbreak concerns grow in U.S. And, Hamas-Israel talks hit impasse
item.description: Many Kentucky residents are bracing for storms as they recover from deadly weather over the weekend. And, the latest on negotiations between Israel and Hamas.
item.content:encoded:
Many Kentucky residents are bracing for storms as they recover from deadly weather over the weekend. And, the latest on negotiations between Israel and Hamas.

(Image credit: ALEXANDER KAZAKOV/POOL/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Doctors urged to treat pain for IUD insertion and other procedures
item.description: A major medical group now recommends pain-blocking treatments for IUD insertion and other procedures amid a growing recognition that women's pain should be treated.
item.content:encoded:
A major medical group now recommends pain-blocking treatments for IUD insertion and other procedures amid a growing recognition that women's pain should be treated.

(Image credit: mariakraynovasrb/500px Plus)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Boden

item.title: Trump has imposed a lot of tariffs. But here's why collecting them can be hard
item.description: Collecting Trump's tariffs could be tricky. The agencies that screen imports say they're frequently overwhelmed and understaffed, and experts say exporters are becoming cannier at evading taxes.
item.content:encoded:
Collecting Trump's tariffs could be tricky. The agencies that screen imports say they're frequently overwhelmed and understaffed, and experts say exporters are becoming cannier at evading taxes.

(Image credit: Charles Rex Arbogast)
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: This award-winning podcast explores finding happiness as a young, single person
item.description: From hundreds of entries, our judges chose one student's intimate telling of the value of lifelong friendships and being single as the grand-prize winner of the NPR College Podcast Challenge.
item.content:encoded:
From hundreds of entries, our judges chose one student's intimate telling of the value of lifelong friendships and being single as the grand-prize winner of the NPR College Podcast Challenge.

(Image credit: Greta Rybus for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta

item.title: A broken thruster jeopardized Voyager 1, but engineers executed a remote fix
item.description: NASA mission controllers raced against time to find a solution before a crucial ground-based radio used for communicating with Voyagers 1 and 2, went offline for upgrades.
item.content:encoded:
NASA mission controllers raced against time to find a solution before a crucial ground-based radio used for communicating with Voyagers 1 and 2, went offline for upgrades.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: The NBA playoffs will end a years-long title drought. The only question is: whose?
item.description: It's impossible to predict what will happen in the NBA's conference finals matchups. But one thing is for certain: One long-suffering fanbase is about to have something to celebrate.
item.content:encoded:
It's impossible to predict what will happen in the NBA's conference finals matchups. But one thing is for certain: One long-suffering fanbase is about to have something to celebrate.

(Image credit: Ellen Schmidt/Getty Images; Lauren Leigh Bacho/NBAE via Getty Images; Garrett Ellwood/NBAE via Getty Images; Brian Fluharty/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: What a Texas showerhead salesman discovered about 'Made in the USA' labels
item.description: A Texas showerhead salesman wanted to know how much more customers would pay to buy a product that's made in the USA. The answer could pour cold water on President Trump's plan to encourage more companies to open factories in the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
A Texas showerhead salesman wanted to know how much more customers would pay to buy a product that's made in the USA. The answer could pour cold water on President Trump's plan to encourage more companies to open factories in the U.S.

(Image credit: Angela Weiss)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Trump is gutting environmental agencies. What does that mean for Americans?
item.description:
The Trump administration is rewriting policies and reducing funding for multiple agencies that handle climate change, including NOAA, EPA and FEMA. We asked NPR reporters Lauren Sommer and Alejandra Borunda what that the implications of that are — and who the changes will affect.

Want to hear more ways research is being impacted by the new administration? Email us at shortwave@nprg.org to let us know — and we may cover your idea in a future episode!

Listen to every episode of Short Wave sponsor-free and support our work at NPR by signing up for Short Wave+ at plus.npr.org/shortwave.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration is rewriting policies and reducing funding for multiple agencies that handle climate change, including NOAA, EPA and FEMA. We asked NPR reporters Lauren Sommer and Alejandra Borunda what that the implications of that are — and who the changes will affect.

Want to hear more ways research is being impacted by the new administration? Email us at shortwave@nprg.org to let us know — and we may cover your idea in a future episode!

Listen to every episode of Short Wave sponsor-free and support our work at NPR by signing up for Short Wave+ at plus.npr.org/shortwave.

(Image credit: Johnrob)
item.dc:creator: Hannah Chinn

item.title: Portugal's election falls short of ending political instability. Here's what to know
item.description: Sunday's vote delivered another minority government for the center-right party. The significant rise in support for the hard-right populist party adds uncertainty.
item.content:encoded:
Sunday's vote delivered another minority government for the center-right party. The significant rise in support for the hard-right populist party adds uncertainty.

(Image credit: Armando Franca)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
